skillTree.localised_description: A proud and loyal beast, Criopus is the personal mount of Elatior. This mighty stag is one of the few things the cruel Prince of the Silvam Dale treasures.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.

skillTree.localised_description: The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Isha's protection can protect the faithful Asrai through the darkest of days.

The dangerous and potent blood of Elatior’s father, Urlar the Enchanter, runs strongest in Elatior’s veins, though he is the youngest child. His three other brothers all assumed the role of ruling the Silvam Dale, but their minds were not sufficiently dedicated to subduing the Wilding Tree, so their souls were taken by the Tree. Though the Prince sees his elder brothers as weak, he still often communicates with them within the Wilding Tree, though the three souls have become far too twisted to remember their past.
Elatior’s chosen few, who have grasped a mere fraction of the Wilding Tree’s power, serve the Silvam Dale as their Seers. Even denizens of Athel Loren avoid these casters.

effects.description: Recruit Rank +4: Seer of Silvam Dale

skillTree.localised_description: Princess Asphalia is ancient and her power has long since deserted her. Her eccentricities are famed across the whole region. It is said that the centuries had claimed her reason, and that her husband refuses to acknowledge the fact. The gossips say that those who question her state of mind would not survive for long. She carries her age in the prosaic manner of a human. Her back is stooped, her skin is sagged and her sight is gone. Such a thing is not usual for the Asrai, and some assume that Asphalia had withered herself as some kind of strange affectation.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: Elatior never displays any signs of infirmity; like a dreadful caricature of power and dignity, his face is grotesque in its magnificence—the features exaggerated and distorted, like those of a statue. Any who witness him would feel all the dreadful weight of his arrogance.

Elatior’s dark magic seeps into the very earth. His touch can almost entirely cast off a place’s anchor to the physical world. To stand before Elatior is to submit your senses to his whims; little hope exists of striking a foe who can reject your reality and substitute his own.
Elatior has gathered much power during his long life, foreseeing all sorts of calamities. Yet he does not warn his kin of those events that do not affect him or his realm.

effects.description:
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Elatior and his Seers have bound the heart of the once-bristling hawthorn that is the Wilding Tree, at no small cost. Thousands of anguished souls weave the lashes that enthrall the tree’s boundless magic to his will.

effects.description:
Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength: +60%
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Elatior harnesses the Wilding Tree’s bottomless hate for its master, channeling the energy of its pain into fuel for his forces.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

skillTree.localised_description: Keeper of Souls and Weaver of Prophecy, Morai-Heg is all-knowing and all-seeing. One withers as the winter oak when her chilling gaze turns inexorably one’s way.

effects.description:
Hidden armies will be visible
	(local region)

attributes.bullet_text:
This unit is permanently visible to the enemy, regardless of line of sight.
	
	Revealed units are not affected by the following attributes:
	 Hide Forest
	 Stalk
	 Unspottable

skillTree.localised_description: Elatior’s entire life builds to a singular moment of great triumph, one for which he has caused much suffering and shed even more blood for. He must not fail in fulfilling his destiny…
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
Without ever uttering a word, Elatior can invade the minds of those around him and wreak havoc while the victims remain helpless.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

items.colour_text: Woven with thousands of tiny spirits, Elatior’s robe lifts him a few feet off the ground. Clouds of glittering wings shimmer over the crumpled damask. Regardless of season, a host of acorn-sized imps flicker and whirr as they hold their host aloft.

items.colour_text: An ornately decorated headpiece passed down to Elatior by his father, Urlar. This crown is a symbol of great power and of the festering taint that lies in the deepest parts of the forest.

backgroundSkills.localised_name: Cruel Prince of the Silvam Dale
backgroundSkills.localised_description: Elatior is a cruel elf, even by Asrai standards. He oversees the tainted lands of the Silvam Dale with his shadowy Seers.

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle
Agent Recruitment: Seer of Silvam Dale
